title: How did me and my wife end up with a daughter with blond hair? I am of European descent and my wife is Japanese. My daughter is the only blonde half Asian I know. - Quora

response.answer_text: Phenotype (what we look like) usually falls about halfway between the parents, but there’s nothing preventing it from being closer to one or the other. In your case, your wife bore the baby so unless she took another woman’s egg, the daughter “is” clearly hers. Your daughter has that blond hair, so very likely you are the father. A quick Google search should dispel silly worries: Blonde, blue-eyed half-Japanese kids Blonde, blue-eyed half-Japanese kids

Probably the blonde hair gene is passed down from any of your ancestors. For you the blond hair gene was hidden but it became the prominent genome factor for your daughter. And that's how she became the blonde half asian. It's the reason based on biology. and no offense but the case might be your wife cheated on you with someone with natural blonde hair. But you should probably get the DNA test and don't accuse anyone without any evidence.

Well I'm blonde my sister was a redhead my dad was also red head and my mum is dark brown. I have green eyes my sister hazel eyes..I do however have cousins on my dad's side who have blonde hair and I dare say it's in my genes somewhere..it's not always dependent on mum and dad and that's it.
Your genetics are very strong, and well, there are some Asians that have natural blonde hair (which is rare but has happened)
